description: Writing unit tests, integration tests, E2E tests, and test coverage improvements
principles: Tests should verify actual behavior, not implementation details
Tests should be deterministic and not flaky
Test names should clearly describe what is being tested
Tests should be maintainable and follow established patterns
Good test coverage reduces bugs and increases confidence in refactoring

input: Code that needs testing or test coverage to improve
Clear description of what should be tested
Expected behaviors or scenarios to cover
Any existing tests or patterns to follow

qualityCriteria.completeness: Happy path tested, edge cases covered, error cases covered, adequate coverage
qualityCriteria.correctness: Tests verify actual behavior, no false positives, assertions are correct
qualityCriteria.consistency: Test structure consistent, naming consistent, setup/teardown patterns consistent
qualityCriteria.performance: Tests run quickly, no unnecessary delays, can run in parallel if needed
qualityCriteria.reliability: Tests don't flake, not dependent on timing, isolated from each other
qualityCriteria.maintainability: Easy to understand what each test does, clear test data, easy to modify

commonPatterns: Test both happy path and edge cases
Use descriptive test names that explain what's being tested
Include setup and teardown when needed
Test error handling and invalid inputs
Aim for reasonable coverage (70-90% is good)
antiPatterns: Testing implementation details instead of behavior
Flaky tests that sometimes pass and sometimes fail
Poor test names that don't explain what's tested
Tests that depend on test execution order
Tests that are slower than the code they test
